originalText.text:
Greg is an expert about the history, food and neighborhoods.
We had several samples (savory and sweets) learned about the history of the hood.
Greg was great. Nice. He‚Äôs not ‚Äútalking down‚Äù but appropriately and professionally educating us.

originalText.text:
Bring your appetite because Greg will not rest until your taste buds and stomach are completely satisfied.
The tour also includes insight on the neighborhoods, history along with the cuisines.
Greg's knowledge, wit and humor kept us entertained throughout the afternoon.
Just wished we could bottle up Greg and take him with us all over the city.

originalText.text: We loved our tour. The description of it is good, but doesn‚Äôt even begin to do it justice of how much we enjoyed the tour. It is a combination of learning about the history of the neighborhood as well as enjoying delicious treats from long standing neighborhood stores. Greg knows his neighborhood, and brings the history of the area, as well as the warmth of the neighborhood, to his descriptions, and made us feel part of his Famiglia.

originalText.text:
Bring your appetite!

Greg Marro‚Äôs Italian food tour is choke full of savory and sweet delights. In addition, there is history and stories about the West Village and Soho that only an insider could share. As a native New Yorker and former West Village resident I was surprise at how much I didn‚Äôt know about the area, the history and the beautifful churches. Yes, there were churches.

Because Greg has the west village in his blood he was able to impart a view seldom seen on tours these days and I‚Äôve done three Italian tours with visiting friends over the years.

Many of the location we hit were established well over a century ago and often run by relatives of the founders. And each offered a culinary treat. There were Brazillian desserts (take the tour to learn the Brazillian/Italian connection), prosciutto, meatballs, Italian rice pudding, espresso and a few things I can‚Äôt pronounce or spell.

I was lucky enough to have a small tour and even the other attendees were fun. In addition to the Italian tour he also does a Polish/Eastern European, Music and a LGBTQ tours. I‚Äôm not sure which one to take next.

Oh, and he also speaks Italian fluently. Selling point, I‚Äôm not so sure, but it‚Äôs beautiful to hear.

I would give this tour more than five stars if I could. I had a blast.

originalText.text: Greg was amazing! So much history (personal too). He shared his family stories, stories about various places, and he seems to have personal relationships with owners and employees of all the stops which spoke volumes. He was such a joy and really made the tour! You won‚Äôt leave hungry- wait until the last stop üòÅüòÅ wish we could bring Greg with us everywhere.
